title: Ticket #1021: libvirt version mismatch from distro (x,y,z)
description: If the distro version of the virt daemon is different then the one bound into condor, they will not be able to run xen or kvm jobs.
remarks:
2009-Dec-10 12:05:56 by tstclair:
This requires documentation for 7.4.1 and fix as part of a umbrella ticket of dynamic linking for 7.5.0

2009-Dec-14 06:46:11 by matt:
This should also be fixed in 7.4. It represents a regression in functionality.

2010-Jun-24 07:24:56 by matt:
Condor is currently using libvirt 0.6.2 with no GnuTLS

https://condor-wiki.cs.wisc.edu/index.cgi/dir?d=externals/bundles/libvirt/0.6.2

2010-Aug-23 17:07:50 by adesmet:
Bulk change of target version from v070402 to v070404 using ./ticket_target_mover.
2010-Oct-27 16:39:01 by adesmet:
Bulk change of target version from v070404 to v070405 using ./ticket-target-mover.

2010-Nov-29 13:33:09 by bbockelm:
Can I bump this ticket? The issue has hit us at HCC (CentOS 5.5 + EPEL, Condor 7.5.4).

I'm working on a personal build of Condor for our site based on Redhat's 7.4.2 SRPM, but it would be nicer if it was fixed upstream.

2010-Dec-01 14:39:02 by tstclair:
A possible solution which may work, would be to dynamically bind to libvirt.so versus static binding the .a. Runtime detection of signature matches could be clean and fail gracefully when needed.

2010-Dec-06 15:31:15 by bbockelm:
When compiling with cmake and enabling a "proper" build, it correctly links in libvirt instead of static compilation.

2010-Dec-16 08:37:13 by tstclair:
A much cleaner and simpler solution, is to install native in nmi and only go non-proper if not found.

2010-Dec-16 14:44:19 by tstclair:
So after much brooding and conversations, the afore mentioned comment + the following should be a good long term strategy for vm:u

1.) Move all libvirt deps to a separate vmgahp2 w/cleanup (7.6)

2.) Create a plugin factory which loads elements of base <hypervisor> for vmgahp to allow users to easily add new ones, and disable if not needed. (7.7)

2011-Jan-07 11:38:08 by tstclair:
Will use local system version if found. Otherwise will fall-back to non-proper builds.
